Especially if I’m willing to do all the setup work for it myself, with the understanding that we can just test out the results first, and turn it off later if there are objections for some reason. content.body:
annevk: if you have time to look at https://github.com/mdn/content/issues/20441 that’d be much appreciated. (Or anybody else who wants to take time to look into it.)

The behavior described in that issue description doesn’t seem to conform to the spec but I’ve not tried reproducing it. The OP has a repro case set up at https://github.com/AtofStryker/understanding-cookie-behavior

content.body:
hmm wait actually I see the issue is just about the statement _“Setting withCredentials has no effect on same-site requests”_ in MDN at https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/XMLHttpRequest/withCredentials.

…which is just wrong in the case where a same-site request is cross-origin

content.body: meanwhile the web editing folks propose a more verbose way to do the same thing (with more control, but still) https://w3c.github.io/editing/docs/contentEditableDisabled/
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: meanwhile the web editing folks propose a more verbose way to do the same thing (with more control, but still) https://w3c.github.io/editing/docs/contentEditableDisabled/

content.body: also -webkit-user-modify: read-write-plaintext-only is at 2%, so if that is not also removed there's no win with removing contenteditable=plaintext-only (which maps to the css property in webkit/chromium)
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: also -webkit-user-modify: read-write-plaintext-only is at 2%, so if that is not also removed there's no win with removing contenteditable=plaintext-only (which maps to the css property in webkit/chromium)

content.body: zcorpan: I've been thinking a bit about your comment about image loading, the microtask it queues, and `<picture>`. I was wondering how that works when `<picture>` is being parsed. Wouldn't you have to wait for `</picture>` essentially? (Which is not something the parser exposes as you probably know all too well.)
content.formatted_body: zcorpan: I've been thinking a bit about your comment about image loading, the microtask it queues, and <picture>. I was wondering how that works when <picture> is being parsed. Wouldn't you have to wait for </picture> essentially? (Which is not something the parser exposes as you probably know all too well.)

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: zcorpan: I've been thinking a bit about your comment about image loading, the microtask it queues, and `<picture>`. I was wondering how that works when `<picture>` is being parsed. Wouldn't you have to wait for `</picture>` essentially? (Which is not something the parser exposes as you probably know all too well.)

zcorpan: I've been thinking a bit about your comment about image loading, the microtask it queues, and <picture>. I was wondering how that works when <picture> is being parsed. content.body: Not willing to do that quite yet (it would involve either manually changing every entry in the current database by hand, via a CRUD interface, or bypassing with a hacky search-and-replace like I do to *generate* the mirror). We *are* paying plinss now to get things fixed properly, so we can reevaluate at the end of the contract. ^_^
